biography.content: Obtained MSc from McMaster university in 1960 .In 1960 went to work with  Prof.R.S.Mulliken( Nobel Prize ,Chem 1966) and Prof.C.C.J.Roothaan at the  Department of Physics ,the University of Chicago. In March 1964 was awarded Ph.D in Chemical Physics under the joint  supervision  of Profs. Mulliken and Roothaan.In July 1964 joined Prof.G.Breit ' group as a Research Physicist at Department of Physics , Yale University, New Haven, USA. In May 1965 joined Assistant Professor of Chemistry at University of Alberta, Edmonton, Canada  and in collaboration with Prof. S. Fraga continued research in atomic and molecular physics and co-authored the classic " Many-Electron Systems: Properties and Interactions", W.B. Saunders, 1968. In 1966 joined Chemistry Department as Assistant Professor of Chemistry at  Simon Fraser University, Burnaby, BC, Canada.Was promoted to Associate Professor with tenure in 1969 and appointed full professor in 1975.I have published over 150 research papers and 3 books .

keyword.content: Relativistic Effects in Chemistry, Heavy and Superheavy elements,Electronn correlation effects in Chemistry, Coupled-Cluster calculations for transactinides
